result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: signed by Spencer Lee and Atty Stormont
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:36 pm.

2:30 PM Spencer David Lee appears in Court,  Atty Alex Stormont, DA Halle E. Hatch for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Stormont states this will be a waiver. Court questions DE. Court finds defendant freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the Defendant probably committed a felony. Court binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Status conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on December 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

11:36  DA Halle Hatch in Court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Spencer David Lee in Court pro se.  Court questions if Defendant has contact PD.  He advises that he just obtained his SS card yesterday, it was a requirement from PD.  DA Hatch questions eligibility and retaining counsel.  Defendant states he has since lost his job.  Court reschedules Status, Defendant is to contact PD ASAP.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on August 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.

NO CONTACT WITH M.M., K.M., H.O. OR Z.T. OUTSIDE THEIR OFFICIAL CAPACITY.

DE from PCJ

3:10 PM Defendant Spencer David Lee appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl Nelson appears by phone, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Court reads complaint aloud. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Walker is requesting a $500.00 CBS w/conditions of   Maintain absolute sobriety and no contact w/M.M., K.M., H.O. or Z.T. outside their official capacity, objection. Court orders a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions requested. Waive time limits.  DE does not qualify for PD - PFAC. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:27 pm.  Status conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.
MM, KM,HO, ZT
